items.title: Install Claude Code
items.note: Requires Node.js 18+. Works on macOS, Linux, and Windows (WSL).

items.title: Launch interactive REPL
items.note: Opens the interactive session in your terminal.

items.title: Check version
items.note: Ensure you're on the latest version.

items.title: Stop Claude (stay in session)
items.note: Pauses Claude mid-response without closing the session. Never use Ctrl+C for this.

items.title: Hard exit the REPL
items.note: Both fully exit Claude Code. Use Escape to just stop Claude.

items.title: Cycle permission modes
items.note: Normal → Auto-accept (⏵⏵) → Plan Mode (⏸). Mode shown bottom-right.

items.title: /clear
items.note: Clear conversation history. Use this between every task.

items.title: /init
items.note: Generates CLAUDE.md by analyzing your codebase. Run this first in every new project.

items.title: /model
items.note: Switch models mid-session. Sonnet for most tasks, Haiku for speed, Opus for hard problems.

items.title: Escape stops, Ctrl+C exits
items.mac:
Escape → stops Claude
Ctrl+C → exits session
items.win:
Escape → stops Claude
Ctrl+C → exits session
items.note: Most common gotcha for new users. Memorize this.

items.title: Explore → Plan → Code → Commit
items.mac:
1. Explore the codebase
2. Create a plan, ask me to confirm
3. Implement it
4. Review diff → commit
items.note: The #1 pattern from Anthropic's internal teams. Never skip the planning step.
